an9.21:1.1: “The humans of Uttarakuru surpass the Gods of the Thirty-Three and the humans of India in three particulars.
an9.21:1.3: They’re selfless and not possessive. They have a fixed life span. They have a distinctive nature.
an9.21:1.4: The humans of Uttarakuru surpass the Gods of the Thirty-Three and the humans of India in these three particulars.
an9.21:2.1: The Gods of the Thirty-Three surpass the humans of Uttarakuru and India in three particulars.
an9.21:2.3: Divine life span, beauty, and happiness.
an9.21:2.4: The Gods of the Thirty-Three surpass the humans of Uttarakuru and India in these three particulars.
an9.21:3.1: The humans of India surpass the humans of Uttarakuru and the Gods of the Thirty-Three in three particulars.
an9.21:3.3: Bravery, mindfulness, and the spiritual life is lived here.
an9.21:3.4: The humans of India surpass the humans of Uttarakuru and the Gods of the Thirty-Three in these three particulars.”
